content: or subtract increase rounds if you are unable to get the proper size you are looking for this will change the stitch count throughout to make the hat extra slouchy add extra rounds before starting the decrease round for the brim special notes each round not including round 1 starts with a chain 1 which does not count as the 1st st of the round when joining each round you should slip_stitch to the top of the first counted st not the initial chain 1 space children s pattern is listed below adult pattern children s pattern is worked throughout round 5 of the adult pattern adult women round 1 using l hook chain 3 counts as 1st half_double_crochet 9 half_double_crochet in 3rd chain from hook join with slip_stitch in top of chain 3 10hdc alternatively you may use the magic_ring method as follows create a magic_ring chain 2 counts as 1st half_double_crochet 9 half_double_crochet in circle join with sl st in top of chain 2 10 half_double_crochet round 2 chain 1 2 half_double_crochet in same st as chain 1 2hdc in the next st and remaining sts around join with slip_stitch in top of beg half_double_crochet 20 half_double_crochet round 3 chain 1 half_double_crochet in same st as chain 1 2 half_double_crochet in next st *half_double_crochet in the next st 2 half_double_crochet in next st* repeat from * to * around join with slip_stitch in top of beg half_double_crochet 30 half_double_crochet diameter should measure about 3 ½ inches across round 4 chain 1 half_double_crochet in same st as chain 1 half_double_crochet in next st 2hdc in next st *half_double_crochet in the next 2 sts 2 half_double_crochet in next st* repeat from * to * around join with slip_stitch in top of beg half_double_crochet 40 half_double_crochet round 5 this is the last increase round for child size move to children s pattern below chain 1 half_double_crochet in same st as chain 1 half_double_crochet in next 2 sts 2hdc in next st *half_double_crochet in the next 3 sts 2hdc in next st* repeat from * to * around join with slip_stitch in top of beg half_double_crochet 50 half_double_crochet diameter should measure about 5 ¾ inches across round 6 chain 1 half_double_crochet in same st as chain 1 half_double_crochet in next 3 sts 2hdc in next st *half_double_crochet in the next 4 sts 2hdc in next st* repeat from * to * around join with slip_stitch in top of beg half_double_crochet 60 half_double_crochet diameter should measure about 6 ¾ inches across round 7-14 chain 1 half_double_crochet in same st as chain 1 half_double_crochet in remaining sts join with slip_stitch in top of beg half_double_crochet 60 half_double_crochet height should measure approximately 6 ¾ - 7 inches add additional rnds here to add height the following rounds will complete the band of the hat you will now switch to a smaller hook the size is easily adjustable by switching to a smaller or larger hook round 15 switch to k hook working in blo chain
